title: COMP/STAT112 Notebook
text:
Introduction
This is my online notebook for COMP/STAT112 course taken at Macalester College. Please, use the side bar on the left for navigation. hello

title: 3  Activity 03
text:
3.1 Exercise 1
head(hikes)

             peak elevation difficulty ascent length time    rating
1     Mt. Marcy        5344          5   3166   14.8 10.0  moderate
2 Algonquin Peak       5114          5   2936    9.6  9.0  moderate
3   Mt. Haystack       4960          7   3570   17.8 12.0 difficult
4   Mt. Skylight       4926          7   4265   17.9 15.0 difficult
5 Whiteface Mtn.       4867          4   2535   10.4  8.5      easy
6       Dix Mtn.       4857          5   2800   13.2 10.0  moderate
##Exercise 2
# Use the ggplot function
ggplot(hikes, aes(x = rating)) + geom_bar()

title: 3  Activity 03
text:
3.2 Exercise 4

# COMMENT on the change in the code and the corresponding change in the plot
ggplot(hikes, aes(x = rating)) +
  geom_bar(color = "orange", fill = "blue") +
  labs(x = "Rating", y = "Number of hikes") +
  theme_minimal()

title: 4  9-4 Entry
text: 4.1 I should’ve started with this course instead of STAT 155…I’m starting the semester learning what code means, instead of how to use it.

title: 5  9-6-24 Entry
text:
Cmd+shift+I is a shortcut for new R code in qmd Unclear what “” does in qmd… “!” takes it from url–>image “[]” becomes the caption for the image Make sure to leave spaces between code (e.g. “x = 100” as opposed to “x=100”) “jo_scare”= “snake case”
Why “qmd”? markdown(formats, but doesn’t run code)–>Rmarkdown(runs R code)–>Quarto Markdown (works with multiple coding languages–Python, Java, and Julia)

title: 6  9-10-24 entry
text:
a frame: variables/features that define the axes of the canvas
a layer: geometric elements added to the canvas to represent data points/patterns (e.g. lines, points)

sometimes called “geoms”/“glyphs” (like hieroglyph)

scales: aesthetics added to geom elements (e.g. color, shape)
faceting: splitting up of data into subplots/facets to examine groups w/in the data
a theme: controls of finer points of plot aesthetics (e.g. font type, background, etc)

title: 7  ggplot stuff
text: ggplot + geom_bar - “geom_bar” is a layer–each think added after ggplot is a layer

title: 8  Chapter 4 Notes
text:
8.1 Notes
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
